entry.title: U.S. Consumer Confidence Rises: Michigan Sentiment Index Beats Expectations in December
entry.content:
Top News
U.S. Consumer Confidence Rises: Michigan Sentiment Index Beats Expectations in December 18 hours ago
The U.S. Michigan Consumer Sentiment Index improved to 53.3 in December, surpassing the previous reading of 51.0 and analyst estimates of 52.0. This increase indicates strengthening confidence among American consumers, which could potentially lead to increased consumer spending and have positive implications for retail sales and economic growth.

entry.title: Ashiana Ispat Seeks Shareholder Approval for Asset Sale and Regulatory Non-Compliance Amid Financial Distress
entry.content:
Ashiana Ispat Seeks Shareholder Approval for Asset Sale and Regulatory Non-Compliance Amid Financial Distress 29 minutes ago
Ashiana Ispat Limited will hold its 33rd AGM on December 29, 2025, seeking approval for a ₹43.10 crore asset sale completed on October 1, 2025. The sale was part of a One Time Settlement with State Bank of India after loan accounts were classified as NPAs. The company's financial statements show significant distress, with total assets down 37.95% year-over-year and negative equity. Ashiana Ispat is also seeking ratification for non-compliance with SEBI's LODR Regulations, citing severe financial distress and urgent OTS timelines as reasons for these actions.

entry.title: Nifty and Sensex Close Higher: IndiGo, Reliance Industries in Focus
entry.content:
Nifty and Sensex Close Higher: IndiGo, Reliance Industries in Focus 23 hours ago
Indian markets ended positive with Nifty 50 at 26,180.90 (+0.57%) and Sensex at 85,698.74 (+0.51%). Market breadth was negative with 2,636 declining stocks out of 4,512 traded. IndiGo announced customer service initiatives, Reliance Industries saw significant block trades and a credit rating upgrade, while Lupin received FDA approval for a generic drug. Apollo Micro Systems projected strong revenue growth, and Chambal Fertilisers reported increased promoter shareholding.

entry.title: HFCL Secures $36.5 Million Export Order for Optical Fiber Cables
entry.content:
HFCL Secures $36.5 Million Export Order for Optical Fiber Cables 1 hour ago
HFCL Limited has announced a significant export order worth $36.5 million (approximately ₹304 crore) for Optical Fiber Cables from a leading European telecom service provider. The order is to be executed by February 2024, marking HFCL's expansion in the European market and recognition of its product quality. This development is expected to boost HFCL's revenue and showcase its manufacturing capabilities. Managing Director Mahendra Nahata expressed delight at securing the order, viewing it as a step towards increasing international business and contributing to the vision of an Atmanirbhar Bharat.
